channel.title: Renamed: java heap error with client
channel.description:
It's basically now a completely new question since the original one was answered. i'm working with Client 455 and the cache 455, and designing a server that will prperly function with this client. So far, with 100% creds to Silab for fixing (A start at least) the update server, i now have the task of making the actual server. So far Ican get as far as entering my username and password, and clicking log in. from there, my client goes to the screen and i get it says "Loading - Please Wait" and my runningbot.bat gets the error "Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space." I need help fixing the java heap space error so I can continue with the constrcution of this server.
Heres a pic of the error in action:
[IMG]http://i126.photobucket.com/albums/p120/battlescape/grrloadyoupoop.jpg[/img]

item.title: Renamed: java heap error with client
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

It probably has something to do with JaGEx listening to your mouse, and this method is probably called when you log off.

Read full topic

item.title: Renamed: java heap error with client
item.dc:creator: @Palidino76 Palidino76
item.description:
@Palidino76 wrote:

alright thanks ill search thro all my classfiles now

i havent finshed searching yet but, ive noticed a fe wof :: with a word or like 2 letters after it, and also, what exactly is this?

public static void method108(Component component, boolean bool) {
component.removeMouseListener(Class47_Sub2.aClass43_1993);
anInt314++;
component.removeMouseMotionListener(Class47_Sub2.aClass43_1993);
if (bool != true)
    aClass53_330 = null;
component.removeFocusListener(Class47_Sub2.aClass43_1993);
}

theres two BigIntegers, one is the exponent, the other is the modulus, one is considerably large than the other, but i cant remember which is which because its been so long since i have looked at RSA

item.source: Renamed: java heap error with client

item.title: Renamed: java heap error with client
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

HINT:
Look for a BigInteger in the client somewhere (not client.java). That’s the js5’s public key. Have fun sending packets with that.

Now, make a cache dumper and find the client’s private key, and with that, you can find out what the server sends to you, and you can send packets to the client yourself. (Since you need a private key to make a public key).’

l2RSA, imo.

Read full topic

item.source: Renamed: java heap error with client

item.title: Renamed: java heap error with client
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Lol The update server is protocol “js5” which is found in the client so, no, it’s not me naming this shit.

JS5 I can only assume stands for “Jagex Server 5”; None the less, it’s not particularly complicated, the client initalizes a connection with id of 15 and then a signed int “version”; The updater either sends back an out of date, unknown version, or some other error-otherwise we receive an “ok” which is 1 I believe(might be 0). After which-The client loads all of the cache files and sends there 4 byte crc in a packet using format (len, crc1, crc2,… crc13); The server checks the crc’s and sends back an “ok” or “unknown version” and so on… The client on recieve of an “ok” sends back a handshake which is “0, 1” or “0, 3” (at least in this version)" and the server sends back it’s handshake and BAM we’re finally done with update server…

Of course this is the bare minimum required to make an update servers chatter; and it’s not got all of the JS5’s protocol implemented, but it does provide for a successful “startup” of a client. I would know; I use it for testing!

Peace out and I hope this helps someone here.

Read full topic
item.source: Renamed: java heap error with client

item.title: Renamed: java heap error with client
item.dc:creator: @Palidino76 Palidino76
item.description:
@Palidino76 wrote:

Alright, I don’t know if I’m getting this error because after you hit log in its pretty much unhadled, but I clikc log in, and the screen goes white, then about a minute later, i get this error with me client:

Error: Class12:152 Class63:292 client:647 Applet_Sub1:238 Applet_Sub1:525 java.l
ang.Thread.run | java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 3
error_game_crash

I would image its from not handling anythin after you click log in since the error takes a minute to occur, but am I wrong, and if so do you know what it is thats causing this error?

------------------------weeee----------------------------------------------------------

Alright the bitch put up a good fight, but i fixed it, now the client loads to connecting - please wait but i get thsi error in my client :
Exception in thread “Thread-3” java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space

i cant seem to get it t ostop saying that lol

Read full topic
